intro: Leucanthemum achilleae, commonly known as the white marguerite or mountain marguerite, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is cultivated in gardens and used in landscape design.
